properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 8 at 2:46PM EST until February 11 at 3:04PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in South
Carolina...

Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties


.Heavy rainfall in upstream river basins combined with hydroelectric
dam releases will produce flooding along the Congaree River through
the weekend and into early next week.

The Flood Warning is extended for
The Congaree River At Columbia.
* until Monday afternoon, or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 1 PM Saturday the stage was 27.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to a crest near
28.8 feet late this evening around midnight. The river will fall
below flood stage by Monday afternoon.
* At 28 feet...Flooding begins in low-lying areas of the Riverland
Park subdivision in Cayce.
* At 24 feet...Flooding also occurs in the Cayce Quarry.
* At 21 feet...Extensive swampland and large areas of farmland and
pasture land downstream from Columbia are flooded. Flood waters
cover the Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The
water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to
play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to noaa weather radio...
local media or the internet for further statements and updated
forecasts.
